Philip Klein , a writer at the conservative American Spectator, explains the appeal for Mike Pence . There are a few factors driving talk of a Mike Pence presidential run. A regular speaker at tea parties, Mike Pence is one of a small number of elected Republicans with an appeal to economic, social and national security conservatives, he writes. Former Secretary of State Colin Powell says he is voting for Barack Obama . "He has both style and substance. I think he is a transformational figure," Colin Powell said on NBC's "Meet the Press." Barack Obama displayed a steadiness. Showed intellectual vigor. He has a definitive way of doing business that will do us well, Colin Powell said. Colin Powell , a retired US general and a Republican, was once seen as a possible presidential candidate himself.
